intro: Adenophora polymorpha var. alternifolia, commonly known as the alternate-leaved bellflower, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It features opposite, alternate, or whorled leaves that are typically lanceolate or ovate in shape. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are usually blue to violet in color, with five petals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its flowering period typically occurs in late spring to early summer.
